recommendations.description:
I am very pleased to provide this recommendation for Yasas. 
 I have worked closely with Yasas on an offshore project for which, he was an intern on the project (based in Sri Lanka) and myself the product owner (based in Melbourne, Australia). The project was agile, hence constant communication with Yasas throughout the project from planning to daily scrums.
 
 Yasas is a very talented and hard working young man with a lot of potential. Yasas is very innovative and always looking for new solutions and fresh ideas that can advance his knowledge to exceed expectations and goals. He is passionate about his work and always seems to have great awareness of new creative strategies and technology.
 
 Yasas is dedicated, enthusiastic, intelligent, and responsible.
 
 The project was a complicated and complexed new technology initiative that required a lot of attention / effort, learning and team work. Yasas's dedication & contribution to this initiative set us up well to make the project a success.
 
 Edmund Sanjeev
 Systems Analyst/ Product Owner 
 Icon Global
 Edmund.sanjeev@iconglobal.com.au\nYasas is a highly-motivated, focused and talented individual who always looking for new challenges. We worked together in 99X Technology on a project which delivered single page web application as a modernization of a legacy healthcare management system. Yasas did a wonderful job in this project by automating the delivery chain using cloud infrastructure of AWS with a modern toolchain and best practices. This greatly increased developer productivity and shortened the development cycle.Ability to taking the ownership of what he get assigned is the rare quality I see in Yasas. Moreover, he got great analytical, programming and presentation skills. I undoubtedly recommend him for any future endeavor which these qualities matter.
Yasas was an excellent intern I worked with very recently. He is magically super fast in grabbing knowledge and being a master of it. He is extremely good at explaining what he knows to the other team members very clearly. He is ultra dependable and you don't need to have any worries about the tasks you give to him. His attitude towards work is extremely great. He is always result driven. I highly recommend him for any project. 
I have had the pleasure of working with Yasas in my capacity as a volunteer and the Programme Director of SL2College. Yasas initially joined SL2College as a Speaker at SL Inspire School Seminars. Given his impressive work ethic and dedication to the team, I asked him to take up the position of Assistant Programme Manager in the seminar team, where he was responsible for organising and coordinating the ground level activities of numerous seminars. One of the many challenges when working with volunteers is the lack of accountability. Yasas is one of the few individuals with whom this is not an issue. When he takes on a responsibility we have complete faith that he would deliver. Furthermore, he is a great public speaker and I have personally witnessed him inspiring hundreds of young school students to pursue higher education.

projects.description:
Projects

Project nameTravelSL - A Context Aware and Personalised Travel Recommendation System
Aug 2016 – Jun 2017

Project descriptionAs Sri Lanka accommodates many tourist attractions with diverse features of interest, the requirement for an application that enables tourists to filter attractions based on personal preference is apparent. “TravelSL” is a mobile application which assists tourists in traveling to places of their personal preference in Sri Lanka. 

The app requires a user to login via a Facebook account to identify the personal travel preferences of the user. Upon registration, a one-time sentiment analysis of posted “check-ins” of the user will be conducted which derives an explicit rating for each location visited by the user, to identify the user’s travel preferences. 

Based on the identified preferences, unvisited locations in any city in Sri Lanka can be rated by a state-of-the-art recommender implementing a user-based collaborating filtering technique. The uniqueness of the solution rests in the use of social media data available on Facebook to identify user preferences and the logic of the recommendation system which can robustly handle the cold start problems. 

“TravelSL” is extremely user-friendly as it then designs an optimum route covering top recommended locations based on the traveling mode, distance, predicted rating and existing reservations for each location made visible to the user on Google Maps.

Technologies Used: Python 3.x, Mongo DB, Android StudioEmbla Sphere - HR Portal
Mar 2016 – Aug 2016

Project descriptionThis is implemented as an internal project of the Embla Software Innovation Pvt Ltd. This is an HR Management system which basically helps to record the information of employees and allowing to see their average working hours, late attendance, remaining and taken leaves and missed punch records. Apart from that, this system facilitates the employees to apply leaves based on their allocations. 

Technologies used: Angular 1.x, Web API2, SQL Server Management Studio, Repository Design Pattern, Unit of work

projects.description:
Sign Language Converter - Research Project
May 2017 – May 2018

Project descriptionThough communication is a necessity of the human being there has not been found a better solution to remove the communication gap between normal and deaf people for Sinhala language. Therefore, in this dissertation, our aim was to propose a system which facilitate the communication between normal and deaf people. Same problem has been addressed by using different techniques in different approaches, but they are for facilitating languages other than Sinhala language. To implement our proposed system, leap motion controller, image processing techniques, NLP module, Weka tool and Festival framework has been selected as technologies. In our design part four main individual research parts are included as identifying hand gesture using leap motion, identifying hand using image processing, feature vector creation using image processing and recognize the sign, convert output text to audio. As per the implementation we did, it obtained higher accuracy in recognizing the sign. But there were several limitations in identifying sign as the system was implemented only for recognizing static signs, the accuracy of the system strongly effects on the illumination and brightness of the environment. Our hope is to improve this system to succeed in recognizing dynamic signs as well.Tour Guider – Web based Application System

projects.description:
News Analyzer
Oct 2016 – Present

Project description"News Analyzer"​ is my level 4 research project that analyze the online news articles to predict there popularity. This project is an ongoing project and it is going to implement as 6 modules as following manner. This system has two roles as "News Publishers"​ and "Readers"​.
1. Popularity predicting module 
2. Publisher area recommendation area
3. Comment Analyzing area
4. Article Content Summary module 
5. Reader article recommended module 
6. Article Tracking module 
Among them 3 & 4 are modules which I am contributing my knowledge. They can describe as following manner. 
Comment Analyzing area (Publisher side) - By this module analyze the comments which has obtained by a particular article and give a comment summary for the publisher to get an idea about his or her article. This module is my contribution for this project. In here I am using Microsoft Neural Network Algorithm to train the data set. As the input I choose article title, comments, comment id(for tracking), rating value. As the out put use rating value. Here assumption is usually people comment their article by rating it. normally give high rate for good comment and low rate bad comment. Then the hidden layer train the data set by using them. After that by using DMX query we will able to predict the rate of a particular given comment. As this way I can categorize high rated comments and low rated comments. Then that result goes to text summarizing module and create a summary for both high and low rated comments. That is good for a news publisher to get an idea about, how their readers think about the articles as well as reliability of articles also able to can obtain. 

Article Content Summary module (Reader Side) - This is my next module which I contribute my knowledge to this project. It creates a summary of recommended article list content. Here happen multiple text summarizing, as my approach, I am going to use TF*IDF graph based approach and NLP knowledge to create the summary.Sayanu Service Management Tool - S2MT

Project nameWireless Sign Language Interepreter
Dec 2009 – Jul 2010

Project descriptionFor many deaf people, sign language is the principle means of communication. This increases the isolation of hearing impaired people. This paper presents a system prototype that is able to automatically recognize sign language to help normal people to communicate more effectively with the hearing or speech impaired people. The Sign to Voice system prototype was developed using Feed Forward Neural Network and the gesture input device was a designed sensor glove. This system recognizes both static and dynamic gestures of American Sign Language including the alphabet and a subset of its words, phrases and sentences. Recognized gestures are translated into voice in real time and the voice input is modeled using a 3D model for the recognition of the signer.

projects.description:
Project nameSETrans - English to Sinhalese Translator
Nov 2011 – Apr 2012

Project descriptionRe implementation of the EngSin Project using Java with optimized algorithms and data structures achieving relative translation speeds no less than 20X.

The new implementation is with the ability to handle a wider set of language as per the use of the Stanford Language Parser for the decoding of the language. It also involves 1st Order Logic to obtain a written Sinhalese output. Statistical methods were implemented to resolve ambiguity. 

The implementation which involves AI techniques was also attempt to resolve information loss using software agents but the method was proved not very successful.

Other creator
Pramod Herath
Project nameEngSin Translator
Sep 2010 – Nov 2011

Project descriptionEngSin Translator is a rule based machine translator built as an exhibit of EngEx 2010 exhibition. The project is aimed at reducing the language barrier especially when it comes to using the internet.

The tool comprises of a language decoding unit that understands language structure of basic English sentences. It the does necessary transformations to suit the destination language (Sinhalese) and finally translates using a bilingual dictionary.

The project served as the foundation the ground research for the SETrans Project which was done in the final year.
Other creators
Pramod Herath Pasindu Ariyarathna

Oct 2011

Project descriptionImplementation of a local video streaming service using Microsoft IIS Live Smooth Streaming and Microsoft Expression encoder.

The tools were favored over other available tools considering cost and ease to deploy in a small period of time. IIS Live Smooth Streaming which delivers content at bit rates appropriate for the client meant smooth viewing and saving of bandwidth.

Apr 2011 – Jul 2011

Project descriptionTo research and gain technical know how to update existing out dated server applications and Linux/BSD based systems to there latest stable versions.

It involved implementing existing Asterisk VOIP servers, Mail Server, LDAP server, Web Server, Proxy Server on latest version of BSD (or some in BSD Jail environments) in VMWare based virtual servers.

The custom billing module at the Asterisk servers were found not directly portable to the latest version and the use of A2Billing or cusom made module as per new API was suggested.

Jun 2011

projects.description:
SafePay
May 2015

Project descriptionSafePay is a project that is to maximize the security of credit/debit cards. Simply a customer can link his/her credit card to his/her phone, so that customer can send an USSD request to activate the card from his mobile phone, before purchasing and that activation will be last for several minutes (5 minutes). After that period of time card goes to deactivated mode and no transactions can be done without activating the card again.

It is a big issue that any third party person can use any ones credit/debit card very easily without any authentication (eg: at super markets, fuel stations...). So this project ensures the security of Credit/Debit cards.

This project was done for the TadHack 2015

Project nameSafePay
May 2015

Project descriptionSafePay is a project that is to maximize the security of credit/debit cards. Simply a customer can link his/her credit card to his/her phone, so that customer can send an USSD request to activate the card from his mobile phone, before purchasing and that activation will be last for several minutes (5 minutes). After that period of time card goes to deactivated mode and no transactions can be done without activating the card again.

It is a big issue that any third party person can use any ones credit/debit card very easily without any authentication (eg: at super markets, fuel stations...). So this project ensures the security of Credit/Debit cards.

This project was done for the TadHack 2015

Other creators
Isuru Abeywardana Tharindu Lakshitha

Each semester GPA results are given as a report.

So this project allows to keep record of your all 4 years GPA records and makes easy to manage it.

projects.description:
Enhancing Trinity Platoform for Handlin High Volume DeNovo Transcriptome Assembly
Mar 2016 – Present

Project descriptionThis is our final year research project, which is on bioinformatics. TRINITY is a set of software tools to assemble transcriptomes for using various fields including health care industry, agricultural industry, etc. Problem in most of these assemblers is that they use high usage of memory and they fails to provide accurate results with high volumes of input data.
This project aims to overcome these problems by using replications of data and try to figure out the acceptable size of input data and to optimize it to handle high volumes of data with low resource usage.

The Little White Wedding Guide provides you with the best opportunity to find your perfect wedding venue. Have a look at what many of Australia’s top venues are offering and decide what meets your needs and wishes. If you already have specific ideas about your big day, you can narrow your search down and find a place that meets your criteria when it comes to location, capacity, style and facilities available. The Little White Wedding Guide helps you to diminish the stress that comes with planning a wedding, available right in your pocket!

Features include:

● View wedding venues from across Australia

● Narrow your search filters to make finding your perfect venue so much easier. Filter includes: location, capacity, amenities, and venue style.

● The ability to instantly get in touch with the venues through a multitude of different channels such as email, phone call and social media. 

● An integrated map so you can know exactly where to find your dream venue. 

● Favourite your venues so you can begin to create a list of preferred venues.

● Share venues details directly with your friends, family and of course partner!

● View testimonials of venues from real brides!

● Scroll through a range of amazing photos from venues who can keep you posted with up to date photos of their venue. 

● Get a link to The Little White Wedding Guide’s website where you can find blog posts, real wedding inspiration pages and also features of the best venues and vendors from around Australia.

projects.description:
Sports Analysis Using Video Tracking
Apr 2015

Project descriptionThe proposed system analyzes sports videos by implementing a robust object tracking
algorithm. Computational complexity of this algorithm is minimal compared to most of
the existing algorithms for tracking objects. Hence the system is able to track the objects
accurately and efficiently.

This is a marker less approach; therefore the main drawback of the prevailing systems is addressed. A video feed taken from a single camera is used to provide relevant
statistics and a 3D reconstruction of the game. Creation of a 3D reconstruction ("Hawk
Eye") using a single video feed is an integral part of this project. A novel algorithm developed to enable this feature and the algorithm also addresses the theoretical problem of perceiving depth using a single viewpoint. This project proposes a method to accurately calculate the 3D location of the ball using a single video feed and details about the standard tennis court in unison. Furthermore
the approach used in the project can be extended to analyze other sports which involve standard courts.

Other creators
Rajith Roshan Chamika Nugegoda Lilantha Nawagamuwa

projects.description:
Attribute Based Image Querying System
Sep 2016 – May 2017

Project descriptionFinal year research project to retrieve images considering the semantic understanding of images inspired by machine learning, deep learning and natural language processing technologies. Through this research project we tested the hypothesis that learning strong feature representations of images can enhance the semantic understanding of images by machines. Through this project a novel recursive hierarchical clustering algorithm is proposed to detect the local optima of the number of clusters of a dataset. A hierarchical clustering approach for clustering images into semantically meaningful mixture types based on a recursive hierarchical clustering algorithm prioritizing the most important features from a high dimensional dataset is developed. Secondly a Convolution Neural Network model to extract the visual patterns with regard to attribute mixture types of the images using deep learning schema by training deep representations of the semantically meaningful attribute mixture types is developed. Thirdly a natural language processing module which decrypts the visual patterns from the Convolution Neural Network module to semantically meaningful natural language representations and the querying by open language text has been developed. An integrated system capable of automatic annotating of images using natural language considering the semantic meaning of images is developed by integrating the above mentioned core modules. Furthermore image querying using natural language queries has also been achieved by the system.

Technologies and tools- Python, MATLAB, Caffe, Tensorflow, Elastic Search, NLTK dependency parser

Other creators
Pavani De Silva Damith Dilshan
See project Attribute Based Image Querying SystemSee project

- visual studio 2015Bricks + Agent is an online community hub for homeowners and trade professionals in Australia to list, discover and connect with one another to complete home projects and jobs. It also has a solution for the Property Managers in Real State companies to manage their properties. This cloud based maintenance solution enables Property Managers to streamline workflows and coordinate all maintenance jobs from one place. Bricks + Agent is a simple and no surprises platform, featuring a full suite of mobile apps for easy access. 

Business Domain: Real state
Client: Australian based Start up
Project Role: Software Engineer
Development Methodologies: Agile/SCRUM
Technologies Used: Android, Java, Microsoft AzureThe first thing many people think of when it comes to congested roadways is the delay. During the morning commute there is additional stress because delays caused by traffic can make people late for work. Therefore lack of information about current traffic condition has caused lot of problems in day to life of people.

As a solution for the above mentioned problems this report refers to a development of a mobile application and a website which can be used to get the reliable traffic data in certain areas. The main source of data is GPS data received form the smart phone. From those it would be possible to identify the location and the moving speed of the vehicle. Therefore the users of this application have to log in to the application in their smartphones that displays crowd sourced data about traffic flows in the area whenever they travel. GPS data will be analyzed via CEP. After analyzing the data accordingly then they are displayed on a map in the android smart phone as well as on a website.

technologies used : - - Android Mobile Application ,
-Webservices 
-java
-MySql , Siddhi ( a type of Query used to analyze data in Complex event Processor , wso2)Language 

Project Supervisor : Mr.Srinath Perera (Vice President, Research at WSO2 Inc.)
Project Supervisor :Dr . C. Amalraj (Lecturer of faculty of information technology,University of Moratuwa)

The system is capable of on demand web page translation and it is capable of identifying subject object and verb phrase of a sentence for translation and even it is capable of deciding the form of a word (Inanimate, Masculine or Feminine) and it is transliterating names and places to make more accurate translation. And also the System is capable of handling the language ambiguity to get the more accurate Sinhala translation.CenterPEDE
Apr 2013 – Oct 2013

Project descriptionCenterPEDE (cen·ter·pead) is the performance testing tool developed at Virtusa bringing together the best of the open source and commercial worlds.

CenterPEDE was developed under the following objectives:

Align and integrate the phases of the performance testing life-cycle.

Increase the user-friendliness and accelerate the performance testing activities.

Nurturing from the robustness of JMeter for web based application performance testing.

Provide comprehensive detailed performance testing results for easier reliable analysis.

Limit the burden on the tool during test execution, to ensure it does not skew the results of the AUT falsely.Online CV System
Aug 2011 – Jul 2012

Project descriptionIn this online CV system we provide facilities to undergraduates to maintain their own profile while they are studying in the university. They can include their details in their own profile and specially their academic qualifications. These unique profiles must be updated daily by either undergraduates or the universities .We ensures that only these two parties can update the profiles. As an example, when a student finishes his/her level -2 in the university, the relevant department or the faculty has the authority to update the profile mentioning the course modules and the grades, that student have obtained. If a student follows an external course they can update their own profiles with that information but they have to prove it by including references. The most important fact is that the system provides the facility to employer companies to know whether the profile is updated by the student or the university. 
When the students leave the university after their graduation they have a complete profile with every necessary details. As a result of that employer companies who are willing to work with fresh and young employees can easily get the information regarding the available CV s on the system .The system has the advantage of finding the employees with qualifications by a filtering system. As an example, a company wants to have a new employee who is capable of web developing, programming with 2-year experience in industry. The company only has to enter these qualifications and submit it on to the system. It immediately gives the list of employees who have those qualifications. And by pressing a one single button they can get the printed CV of that employee.Ultimate Transport System for Buses
Feb 2012 – Mar 2012

Project descriptionAs everyone knows well, there can't be seen a proper time scheduled transportation system in Sri Lanka. Still many people meet with huge difficulties when they want to find the time tables of those systems. So we came up with a solution for that and we implemented this product in the Colombo Hackathon - The first ever hackathon in Sri Lanka. Simply we use a mobile application and we use Android mobile development and USSD technologies in the mobile application. Main server is run in java Tomcat server. We plan to introduce this product to customers near future through the help of Etiselat mobile partners in Sri Lanka.Automated Message System for Education institutes
Aug 2010 – Jul 2011

Project descriptionThe aim of this project is to develop an Automatic messaging system for students and academic staff members of Universities and Institutes to send and receive academic information through the SMS technology among them and develop a database to store the student’s information. This system will work as a bridge between students and members of the academic staff.

Feb 2014

Project descriptionTo overcome the current inefficiencies in various POS payment systems, EPIC has designed its proprietary MPOS (Mobile Point of Sales) Merchant Acquiring Platform with eZGO. It is a new platform that enables acquirers to quickly provide smart phone driven Magnetic Stripe and Chip Card payment solutions to small and medium-sized merchants.
With eZGO, Merchant Smart Phone is transformed into a secure point-of-sale device and it is plugged in with a Card Reader, which meets following industry security standards: EMV Level 1, EMV Level 2, PCI PTS 3.0, SRED, PA DSS, and PCI DSS.
The Card Reader connects to a smart phone or tab via audio jack and enables merchants to accept both Magnetic Stripe and Chip Cards using a secure Mobile Application. The Application is compatible across all platforms including Android, iOS, Blackberry and Windows Phone.
The unique design and security architecture of the Mobile App delivers 1st level point-to-point data encryption and high end Terminal Line Encryption (TLE). All transaction related security keys are stored in a Secure Area of the Smart Phone which is 100% fool proof and inaccessible to unauthorized entities.
Solution provides the capability in capturing customer signature prior to authorization and the digital receipt for completed transaction could be sent via an SMS or an E-mail.Customer service evaluation systems. (SCSE)

Transbridge Monitoring Tool - LOLC
Aug 2014 – Aug 2014

Project descriptionTransbridge is designed to plug any ATM network and core banking backend. Financial institutes need a bridge to connect back end with third party ATMs. ATMs communicate with their backend via ISO 8583 messages.
ISO Transabridge is designed to break and construct ISO 8583 messages. It is a matter of time to implement interfaces to break vendor specific ISO formats and backend transaction handling. We have followed Factory and Proxy design patterns to overcome the issue of connecting ATM networks and back end.
The product is released with a monitoring tool and ISO message generator. Monitoring tool is used to monitor sever status and transaction history. ISO message generator is designed to act as ATM for testing connectivity and transactions.
Software/ Technology Used:
• Java 1.7 , Spring core/Dao
• Sl4j / logback - logging
• JUnit - unit testing

jobs.jobTitle: Senior Mobile Software Engineer / Tech Lead
jobs.description:
Key Responsibilities 
 
• Design the main architecture of mobile applications with detailed technical components. 
• Evaluate detailed business, functional, and high-level technical requirements including recovery, security, and audit. 
• Prepare the development plan according to the requirements gathered/finalised from clients. 
• Distribute responsibilities among the team members based on skills and other factors. 
• Provide management leadership in the development and delivery of iOS and Android native applications. 
• Ensure development activities are aligned with scope, schedule, priority and business objectives. 
• Review software developments of whole team, and guide to correct direction while maintaining a development standard. 
• Always make sure the software projects come in on time and under the estimated budget. 
• Communicating with clients continuously to keep them updated and provides technical consultancy for their requirements. 
• Ensure the delivered solution meets the technical specifications and design requirements.

Key Responsibilities 
 
• Development of mobile applications for multiple eCommerce properties on mobile platforms, integrating to various internal and external API services. 
• Work with UX engineers and designers to produce best outcome. 
• Responsible for continued enhancement and maintenance of production mobile software. 
• Develop robust and properly tested implementations, and ensure successful production deployments with minimal defects. 
• Work with other engineers to create and maintain efficient and viable practices throughout the software development life cycle. 
• Playing the role of scrum master in agile environment

Key Responsibilities 
 
• Write new software, make modifications to existing software, and integrate software applications and modules in accordance with agreed upon specifications. 
• Best possible suggestions for problem solutions or software enhancements. 
• Implement/Develop application solutions as directed within standards. 
• Participate in agile planning sessions with team members to analyse development requirements, provide design options, and provide estimates of work. 
• Develop Android applications with enterprise API services. 
• Directly work with clients to achieve best outcome of the project. 
• Developing enterprise web applications using Google Web Toolkit (GWT®) and JSP, EJB, Hibernate frameworks.

Key Responsibilities 
 
• Develop software using disciplined software development processes, adhering to team/company standards and software best practice guidelines, and corporate policies. 
• Work with the development team to develop mainly government pension web application. 
• Contributed to system reporting module of government pension application using Open Office java UNO API. 
• Mainly developed systems using J2EE with Hibernate framework and Oracle database. 
• Participate in agile planning sessions with team members to analyse development requirements, provide design options, and provide estimates of work. 
• Assist QA engineers about system architecture and reporting module to continue with testing process.
- Developing java enterprise applications using JPA, EJB, Hibernate frameworks.

Project nameAdTruth Resolver
Jul 2014

Project descriptionMarketers are inefficient in their ad spend since they are not able to reliably target individuals due to web access channels (e.g. multiple browsers, native apps) and device proliferation. These inefficiencies can be due to factors such as poor conversion analytics, too broadly targeted media or not reaching a customer during their decision journey. 
Zander is creating an id for each device and household that can be reliably targeted and analyzed when only anonymous data is present. In addition, Zander will support client supplied attributes such as one way hashed identifiers that are representative of PII. Zander is using all available ids as inputs to create the device level ID. 

Technologies: Java, Spring, PostgreSQL, NoSQL (Aerospike), Amazon Web Services, RabbitMQ, DropWizard, JUnit

Project nameA Javascript Visualizer and Analyzer
Jan 2014 – Jan 2016

Project descriptionWebsite development is one of the most prominent development areas in software development industry. Developing and maintaining a web site is a difficult task due to the increasing complexity of web site development. The most popular programming language is JavaScript. It is highly dynamic and weakly typed language. Therefore, development tools which are currently available for JavaScript still haven’t reached a level on which the developers can rely on. The main reason for this is that JavaScript frameworks are being developed faster with different architectures and therefore, JavaScript helper tools can become obsolete as soon as new frameworks are introduced.

There are helper tools available which would analyze a given JavaScript file or generate a call graph for a JavaScript file or generate a dependency graph for a given web site project. However, some of them are no longer supported and most of them depend on other libraries like JavaScript parsers and therefore, those dependencies are needed to run them, which can be a usability problem. Furthermore, none of the previous work or currently available tools were able to generate a call graph dynamically while the website was running, which would immensely facilitate in debugging the web site.

general.headline: Senior Software Engineer at WebQuarters®
general.description:
I am a Senior Software Engineer with more than 5 years of experience in developing industrial level solution using .Net web technologies like SharePoint, ASP.Net..etc. I have worked in globally renowned software solution providing companies like Virtusa, Totalamber, WebQuarters and work for some major clients like United Technology Cooperation(USA), ShowCor, Coveris, KF Aerospace(Canada). I have also recognized as Subject Matter Expert for Nintex Tools that runs top of SharePoint since I have experienced worked in several Nintex projects till now.

Recently i have being part of the project team and playing major role solution that we developed for Heroux Devtek that Migrated millions of documents into searchable format (OCR) into SharePoint Online, also we have changed the information architecture into suitable manner. Also I have led project of KF Aerospace, to manage Snag Requests(MRO) on client site in Canada. I focused on developing a middleware/frontend to existing MRO system build on Infor M3 framework using ASP.Net and JQuery with some enhancements to existing system. project concludes with successful user trial, taking part with actual stakeholders of their business. Currently involving in internal product developed by company itself using latest ASP.Net and JQuery technologies.

Colleagues known me as a technical guy and I also try to get best out me on technical terms by understanding what business needs. I also like to work alone, but I’m at my best as a team.

I have graduated from Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology in 2012 as a Bachelor of Science (Special) in IT (Specialized in Software Engineering)

Because of that the system will not perform as their expected performance. In order achieve the best performance Dialog decided to move their components one by one to micro service architecture from monolithic architecture.CCP
Nov 2015 – Feb 2017

Project descriptionMillennium information technology developing the clearing system called Counter clearing party (CCP) by using C++ language and distributed system architecture. In order to evaluate the distributed system components the system developed called CCPTest by using Java. The framework have the capacity to simulate the real system and support to do the component testing and end to end testing. 
I was worked with gateways team, which one of the technical team in CCP Project and specially involved on interpret the gateway messages with using various technologies such as JAXB, String manipulation, XML parsers… etc. Had the experience on FIX, FIXML 4.0, 4.2, 4.4, 5.0, SWIFT, CREST, SOCGEN… etc.Evinta Weight and Balance System for WIZZ and VIM air
Feb 2015 – Oct 2015

Project descriptionDeveloped a web based aircraft weight and balance application for aeroport handlers at KIV airport located in Chisinau, which was supported to bulk loading type aircraft such as A320 series. The aeroport handlers handle the multiple airlines at KIV airport. In the initial phase WIZZ and VIM airlines were implemented on Evinta Weight and Balance system. The WIZZ and VIM airlines had 63 and four aircraft registrations respectively, and all of them are moved to Evinta Weight and Balance System. The Evinta Weight and Balance application calculate the center of gravity (COG) and validate the COG within the envelope by using the Index based calculations. In addition, the application has the admin functionality in order to maintain the aircraft handling manual (AHM) data for the Evinta Weight and Balance system. It simplifies the complicated process of planning and distributing weights of an aircraft such as fuel, cargo, mail, etc through an easy to use visually simulated process.Kenyan airways Corporate Booking Engine
May 2013 – Oct 2015

Project descriptionDeveloped a corporate booking engine (CBE) for Kenya airways. The corporate booking engine helps SMEs and corporate clients to make online flight reservation (searched by date and by fare) using different payment options such as credit cards, on hold, on account and on mobile. In addition to making a online booking, the user has the booking amendment functions such as cancel itinerary, cancel segment, refund, split, reschedule (date change / booking upgrade / flight change) . The CBE also has an administration module to maintain the Corporate user accounts, maintain the discounts, commissions, approval process, diagnostic screens and the reports etc. The CBE integrates with Amadeus altea GDS web services for flight availability and the reservations.Evinta Weight and Balance

Project nameSiemens Energy RNA | REU

Project descriptionSiemens Energy Sector is one of the world’s leading suppliers of a wide range of products, solutions and services in the field of energy technology. The Field Report Writer (FRW) is an application used by Field Engineers, Technical Officers, Sales Teams and other Divisions to generate and manage various types of field reports. Currently different versions of FRW applications are used in two main geographical regions named Region North America (RNA) and Region European Union (REU). The FRW is a client-server application with a workflow engine. The main objective of this project is to re-engineer the current RNA/REU server side (including the workflow) and the client side applications and develop a common application which is compatible for both the regions to ease the maintainability and extensibility. The secondary objective is to use Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) instead of Microsoft InfoPath to enhance the look and feel and the user experience while using Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) for client server communications.

Jan 2016 – Aug 2016

Project descriptionMaster data application is a .net project which act as an interface between SAP and User. Due to lack of functionalities and facilities provided by SAP, Master data project was created.
The main task of the application was creating and maintaining the data in SAP. As an example SAP contained data regarding products which MAS create, material they used, customers and vendors of the company and etc. Master data project contained sub projects like customer master and vendor master. Vendor master was done by me. There were several roles of users in the application like requester, 1st approver, 2nd approver and super user. When requester create a data set it should be approved by 1st approver and 2nd approver before sending them to SAP. Until it is send to SAP data were saved in SQL server. Each user is informed by email with relevant link.
This is a .net web application which used layered architecture (Client layer, WCF Service layer, Business logic layer and data access layer). Front-end development was done with angularjs because it provide much more functionalities for creating interface, validation and etc. client application layer contained with html files, JavaScript files, angular service and c# controllers. Business logic layer was accessed through WCF service layer. Entity framework and stored procedure were used in Data access layer to work with SQL server. Repository pattern with Generic classes was used for executing functions with database.

Project nameCropAdvisor
Sep 2015

Project descriptionIn Sri Lanka, a considerable amount of information relevant to farmers involved in the export sector is held within government departments and Ministries. How can we create a solution that enables farmers to receive important information vital to their work and also allow them to share information about disease outbreaks and other issues?
CropAdvisor addresses the above problem. It is an Android app that has information related to crop advisory, the ability to take geo-tagged photographs and upload to a platform for identifying and tracking diseases, and a platform where farmers can advertise to exporters. This is a two way information channel for farmers. It enables farmers to receive the data stored in a central information database. Regarding field preparation, harvesting, packaging, water management, diseases, pesticides etc. Also they can ask their issues through the Android application and receive expert’s feedback.

projects.description:
WSO2 IoT Server
Apr 2015 – Dec 2017

Project descriptionWSO2 IoT Server is a complete solution that enables device manufacturers and enterprises to connect and manage their devices, build apps, manage events, secure devices and data, and visualize sensor data in a scalable manner.

It also offers a complete and secure enterprise mobility management (EMM/MDM) solution that aims to address mobile computing challenges faced by enterprises today. Supporting iOS, Android, and Windows devices, it helps organizations deal with both corporate owned, personally enabled (COPE) and employee-owned devices with the bring your own device (BYOD) concept.

WSO2 IoT Server comes with advanced analytics, enabling users to analyze speed, proximity and geo-fencing information of devices including details of those in motion and stationary state.

Project namePublic Complaining System
Oct 2014 – Oct 2014

Project descriptionNBQSA 2014 Gold Awarded project (in Business Category-Tertiary)

The system contains a web service which can be accessed via a website, mobile app and SMS. Users can post their complaints regarding issues on services, service providers and infrastructure, while other users (including government sectors, private companies, volunteers etc.) can comment and vote on them. This can act as a medium to emphasis the "real" problems that already exists among us. This is really beneficial for:

general public : get their problems to responsible parties and get comments/suggestions from others
companies : obtain customer feedbacks and identify the issues to be addressed.
government authorities : identify the malfunctioning sectors.
news agencies : NEWS
volunteers : identify the real problems and help to obtain solutions.

Other creators
Praneeth Peiris Milindu Sanoj Kumarage Dhanushka Chandana 
Project nameSPAM-Bot
Oct 2014 – Oct 2014

Project descriptionThis is an Autonomous Robot designed to navigate across a map and collect payloads distributed at various points. These payloads are delivered at the other end of the map in a sorted order (adjacent to each other with only the last payload on top if the previous one). The sorting is done according to a barcode number printed on each face of the payload.

The project is build using the Arduino UNO and Arduino duemilanove/ATmega328p boards. It makes use of continuous rotational servos for the wheels of the robot and positional rotational motors for the robot arm and gripper. IR sensors are used to detect and follow the navigational path. A Sonar sensor is used to identify the payloads across the map. A Rasberry Pi connected to a normal Webcam is used to capture the payload key and process it.

Other creators
Shabir Mohamed Praneeth Peiris Madura Anushanga

projects.description:
IceFresh
Oct 2014 – Present

Project descriptionThis is the most compelling project that I have contributed in my career. It is a full supply change management system implemented for a fish selling company in Norway, supported with a E-commerce front end as well. Fish caught in Norway and Sri Lanka are exported to China and sold through online stores to a Chinese niche. This project includes a number of integrations with Chinese 3rd parties such as Alibaba, JingDong, Warehousing (PFS), and delivery services such as Yamato, SF. System contains a fully customized Dynamics CRM solution to support inventory management, shipment management, order management, customer handling and product catalog managemet, supported and strengthened by a stable NodeJS backend. NodeJS back end acts as a communication layer between 3rd parties and the CRM solution. Technologies and platforms cover Dynamics CRM, NodeJS, Angular JS, Mongo DB, Azure etc.

Other creator
Malinda Perera
Project nameAn Adaptive Gamified e-Learning System Based on Student Modeling
Dec 2012 – Present

Project descriptionIt is an adaptive e-Learning platform based on some modeling techniques. Gamification was utilized to enhance student motivation. 3D games are used as the main learning material. To plan the adaptation 2 main mathematical models were used. The first one is a knowledge model which measures the concept-wise knowledge of users based on a mathematical theory known as Dempster-Shafer Theory. The other one is a fuzzy logic based behavior tracking model which measures the level of interaction and performance of users within the 3D games (Learning Materials). The results of these models are used to deliver an adaptive, interactive and personalized learning experience to the learners. Algorithm construction was done using C# and the game construction was done with Unity 3D and C# scripting.

Project nameEnki
Jan 2012 – Present

Project descriptionIt is a knowledge sharing system specially designed for organizational context. When a question is asked by a particular user, that question is automatically directed to the best expert within the organization. The expert is recognized based on a multi-criterion process including expertise, geographic location, companionship etc. This was a service based application and I was responsible for tagging the question (extracting key words). The tagging algorithm was designed after a research carried on natural language processing.

Other creator
Nuwan Samarasekera

Project descriptionIt is a geo-information based mobile application for iphones. Target audience of the app was travel lovers/hikers and they have the ability to find, share, save locations, purchase maps for offline usage etc. For map generation, a 3rd part map service called Faster Imaging was used. I was involved in Objective C based app development, Java back end development and amazon cloud management tasks.

Project nameBusiness Intelligence Framework to analyze data related to organizational middle ware

But we integrated a number of features that should be in a BI environment such as graphical representation of data (a dash board), standard and customized reports, statistical analysis and data mining. We used Apriori algorithm to find some relationships between those data.

And the system automatically takes corrective actions if the parameters deviate from a predefined range.

Product Name:  ISO - Transbridge
Transbridge is designed to plug any ATM network and core banking backend. Financial institutes need a bridge to connect back end with third party ATMs.  ATMs communicate with their backend via ISO 8583 messages. 
ISO Transabridge is designed to break and construct ISO 8583 messages. It is a matter of time to implement interfaces to break vendor specific ISO formats and backend transaction handling. We have followed Factory and Proxy design patterns to overcome the issue of connecting ATM networks and back end. 
The product is released with a monitoring tool and ISO message generator.  Monitoring tool is used to monitor sever status and transaction history. ISO message generator is designed to act as ATM for testing connectivity and transactions.

projects.description:
Sinhalapedia
    Starting January 2011

    Team members:
            Tishan Dahanayakage,
            Nirman Kodithuwakku,
            Chamith Nilanka Wijesinghe

    Wihidum : Distributed CEP
    February 2013 – February 2013

    In the present world, complex event processing (CEP) is becoming increasingly popular in present highly competitive enterprise culture. Its ability to analyze series of events in real time and deduce results based on those events is highly sought after. Today even a handset can be used as a sensor device to generate events for analyzing. The growth of sensor devices has evoked the possibility of event streams that surpass processing capabilities of present CEP products. Hence, new techniques are needed to overcome these issues.

    One suitable solution to overcome the above mentioned challenge is to implement a distributed CEP solution. Distributed solution consists of multiple CEP nodes that run as a single system but are distributed among multiple physically separated machines connected by a network.
    Although we deploy a distributed system, we cannot achieve theoretical maximum performance due to performance losses arise from several reasons. Main challenges of this project is trying to minimize these losses in order to increase the performance gain.
    WSO2 CEP will be used as CEP nodes for this project.

    Team members:
            Tishan Dahanayakage,
            Sameera Kannangara,

Project nameHRM Enterprise Absence Management Module
Feb 2010 – Present

Project descriptionDevelopment of One of a Key Module runs in HRM Enterprise Suite. 

This module has several components such as Web Application, Kiosk Application, Mobile Application, API layer etc... 

Once an employee submits a leave application, it will go through an approval workflow before he/she is granted the leave. Such a system can ease the lives of both the leave applying and the approval parties namely the subordinates and the supervisors.

Absence Management can be performed accurately as employees’ leave is recorded systematically for long time periods. Employer and the employee can anytime access the system to find the leave specific details.

Absence Management Module, a significant module of the HRM Enterprise suite, covers the entire life cycle of the leave applying, approval and management process. 

The significance of this module is it suits any size of organization from 50 employees to over 25000 employees , for any industry area, for any country without doing any changes at source code.

Project nameTransformation of Sri Lanka's Largest Apparel manufacturer's operational HR
Feb 2013 – Dec 2015

Project descriptionThe Organization is geographically dispersed across 38 locations in Sri Lanka, India and Bangladesh. Due to its expansion through merges and acquisitions during the time, each of these factories had their independent and incongruent HR operations and processes running on siloed systems of hSenid HRMenterprise, which led to adopting inherent home grown practices. The challenge was to get a consolidated view of HR operations and KPIs. 
In addition, the lack of a standard solution throughout the organisation led to audit issues, compliance violations and fraud. Thus, the objective was to streamline processes, standardise the key HR functions across the entire group and have a single centralized solution with embedded industry best practices which would provide the ability to receive consolidated information from across the group which enables better control over all factories within the group for strategic decision making.

Project nameGNTracker – IoT Device
Apr 2016

Project descriptionThe GnTracker device was in-house developed as a remote tracking solution to better enhance the service delivery of Laugfs International, the authorized agent for Yamaha and Airman generators. The service calls for generators are usually triggered by the customer, after which the maintenance team at Laugfs International respond with the necessary services, as is the practice with most after-sales service providers in Sri Lanka. The pioneering GnTracker device now allows the maintenance teams to remotely monitor and track generator performance and proactively trigger service calls, transforming the customer experience. As an effective and scalable solution, the GNTracker is the first of its kind to be developed in Sri Lanka and is faceted with features that make it an ideal solution, not just for Laugfs International, but for other organisations and industries. The GnTracker unit can be attached not only to Generators, but to any equipment, which requires triggered alerts and other important information related to the device’s operation. As a result, this new product solution can be applied in many different industries, irrespective of the product or brand, making it a highly scalable product.

Key Responsibilities : 
- Architect / Design & develop the IoT Device and Firmware to communicate with cloud
- Architect / Design & develop the Back end web application to monitor the IoT device data

- .Net / C# / MVC / Azure / Azure Web SQL

Project nameExpressway Life Saver (ELS)
Jan 2015 – Nov 2015

Project description With the increasing population, usage of expressways has been a popular mode of transportation around the world. Although highways cater the speed of life, it compromises the safety of its users which in fact requires more safety measures while traveling in them. Even though, highway statistics provide the fact that the rate at which accidents occur are seemingly low, the impact or the fatality of accidents were very high. Therefore, an autonomous system that would cater all the above problems was in need.
The Expressway Life Saver caters this issue by providing efficient accident prevention strategies and post-accident recovery plans. It intends to make the highway systems safer for all the user groups from drivers to passengers by a technological solution. The device is portable and thus convenient to use while traveling. Unlike in other safety systems, it prevents accidents with its speed alerts and keeps the driver in focus with its interactive interface. It alerts the authorities in situations of reckless driving or in an occurrence of a fire or a crash. Also, it backs up highway user data into a database which could be used to the effective handling of the highway system. The system comes as a package of all these features embedded with cutting-edge technology, making it competitive in the marketplace in contrast to its alternatives.
The device consists of typical fire sensor and utilizes GSM, GPRS and GPS technologies in order to pass messages and to generate speed, the location of the vehicles. Several test runs were carried out and the outcomes were quite accurate. It responded positively in low signal coverage and resisted quick flames. In overall it was quite a success and could be further developed with the introduction of sophisticated technology.

projects.description:
A Performance Evaluation for automatically generated Data Mining algorithms in different Machine Learning Libraries
Project descriptionThis is my final year research project that is currently in progress. This project enables any user, either a novice or expert, to specify a problem related to data mining and write a simple pseudo code using natural language. The natural language specifications are then converted to a universal intermediate model written in XML. The intermediate model is then converted to the actual implementation of the machine learning codes in SKLearn (Python) and R. The results from the different library implementations are compared and an evaluation and interpretation of the results are provided to the user, similar to an expert system. This project was undertaken to allow even novice users to perform analytics and also to evaluate the different libraries/languages with regard to their performance, since most data analysts are familiar with a single library/language. 
My part of the project is the conversion of the XML model to the actual code. Although conversion of pseudo code to source code is not a new idea, most of the research involves using rule-based approaches. This can be exhaustive as it demands the implementation of a large number of rules and extensive specification of regular expressions. My research involves using a more efficient and automated technique to perform the translations, inspired by techniques of Natural Language Machine Translation(MT) such as Statistical Machine Translation and even Neural Machine Translation. The research is ongoing however, my part of the project most probably needs a hybrid rule-based and MT approach.
Other creators
Dinusha Harankahawa Madusha Gunasekera

Project descriptionThis was a project that was inspired by the lack of technological infrastructure in the museums of Sri Lanka. Instead of separate multimedia systems installed for different galleries/artifacts, a robot was developed, that guides museum visitors along a designated path and provides information about key artifacts in the museum via video. The robot is programmed to stop near the artifacts, identify the location and play a video file relevant to that artifact. This project has the potential to save the huge costs that museums spend on installing multimedia systems since all of these tasks are achieved with one system and is especially ideal to be applied in Sri Lankan museums, where tourists' interest for historical information is a priority on their itineraries.

projects.description:
Responder
Feb 2018 – Present

Project descriptionA GitHub Integration built with Probot that sets expectation for response for new contributors. In open source projects any new contributor can create pull requests or issues. When contributors do one of the following things they always seek for the feedback from the existing contributors (maintainers). As the contributors are unaware when the maintainers will respond them, they have to check the activity of the repository time to time. When contributors are acknowledged properly, it is easy to keep their interest on particular project. The Responder is to acknowledge the contributors in a timely manner and to get the attraction of the maintainers towards the contributors in an efficient manner. This will predict the response time by calculating the average of the initial responses given by the maintainers to previous issues and pull requests. Then a bot can acknowledge the contributors when they can receive a response. Also adding a label to indicate the remaining time will grab the attention of the maintainers and help them in responding to contributors. Other than that maintainers can define categories to issues/pull requests beforehand so that contributors can use them and categorize their issues/pull requests.

Project nameFileX
Apr 2016 – Apr 2017

Project descriptionWith the immense development of the technology most of the organizations in the business world tend to use technological aspects to make their operations more convenient. Software industry which steps forward with the innovative technologies always ensure that it is up to date with the latest technology that can be applicable on its operations. Development of a software project passes through various stages of the Software development life cycle. Starting from the requirement gathering stage a specific set of documents has to be created, approved and maintained throughout the process of development. Before commencing the development of a system it should be approved by a set of responsible roles in the company. Software Requirement Specification (SRS) document which states the required functionality of the system is one of the major documents that is to be approved. Most of the companies use a paper based method for the approval process which is handled manually by responsible individuals. However this manual file based system is said to be consists of several drawbacks such as time wastage, less efficiency and resource wastage. In addition the progress of the approval process cannot be monitored through a paper based mechanism. In an effort to overcome these problems ‘FileX’ document approval system introduces a web based application and an iOS mobile application to make the document approval process more efficient. The system facilitates to create projects, assign responsible roles, upload documents, approve SRS document and monitor the progress of approval. The system was evaluated using user centric methods and results indicated that it reduces the time consumed on approval process and reduces the resource wastage making the overall process more effective and convenient. With this respect FileX gives an impressive experience to the user rather than the conventional method.

Technologies: JSP, Servlets, Oracle Database, JavaScript, HTML, CSS & Bootstrap framework

Project nameGarage and Service Station Reservation System
Jul 2016 – Feb 2017

Project descriptionThis was the second year industry based project. Cooperated by four members. I acted a the team leader.
This software slotion for a Garage and Service reservation system which resolve lot of problems in reserving garage and service stations. Main issue that is observed here is that lot of queues near garage and vehicle reservation stations that waste human valuable time. Through this system a Garage or service owner can display their services while a vehicle owner can buy or make reservation for a service. Fist a service or garage owner need to log in to the system and display their services in the system. Then a vehicle owner can add their vehicle in to the system and request for those services. As additional feature a Garage and Service station management system and online buying system is included here. There is no existing system in Sri Lanka. Therefore this project can be considered as an innovative system for Sri Lanka. This is basically a web and android project. Spring with JDBC is used as the web frameworks. Technologies such as JavaScript, JQuery, and AJAX are used to make the client side more interactive. Google Maps and Street view API are used as additional feature in this system. Through this system the problem in reserving garages and service stations are solved to great extent. 
Technologies Used : Java 8, Spring MVC, JDBC Template, Google Maps, JavaScript, JQuery, AJAX, MySQL, Boostrap
Other creators
Naduni M Gamage Lachithra Chathura Galappaththi Ishara Dikkumburage Dilka Sithumini

Project nameSmart Fan
May 2015 – Apr 2016

Project descriptionThis was the first year hardware project. This was group project including 5 members. I acted as the group leader of this project.
This project was a Smart Fan which could be used to detect human being and rotate to the direction of that human being. As additional features this fan is sensitive to sound, humidity and temperature and adapt accordingly. 
PIR sensor was used to detect the location of a human being. After the detection the fan automatically rotates to the direction of that human.
Humidity sensor and temperature sensor will sense the environmental conditions and helps the fan to adapt to different conditions.
Technologies used : ATMEGA32A Micro-controller, DHT11 Sensor, PIR Sensor, Stepper Motor, Atmel Studio

Other creators
Naduni M Gamage Kasun Sandaras Sanduni Geshala

Project nameAdora.lk
May 2017 – May 2018

Project descriptionAdora.lk is an online marketplace which aims at providing customized apparels along with a
user-friendly graphical interface to design bespoke apparels.
This grants customers the privilege of printing t-shirts according to their necessity, by uploading
the desired pattern or the design they wish to print. Furthermore, they are allowed to customize
their apparels conforming to their requirement by uploading any design they prefer. When a
customer visits the website to purchase a product, his/her measurements will be taken in order to
decide an appropriate size from the available sizes(S, M, L). Subsequently, the customer can fit
on their clothes from the smart devices available at department stores. This process follows the
concept of “a virtual fit on room”.
Customers are granted the benefit of visualizing clothes on a VR model using a VR glass.
Adora.lk has the feature of giving suggestions to its users. These suggestions are filtered in
accordance with the user attributes. Basically this assists customers by recommending the most
suitable outfits. The recommendations are done according to,
· Previous searches from social media, and site itself
· Customer attributes(Complexion, Body shape).
Customers are encouraged to collaborate with the designers in order to make their dream design
breathe to life.
The purchased apparels will be delivered at your doorstep.
Smart Payments

Project nameSapphires.lk
Jun 2017 – May 2018

Project descriptionSapphires.lk is a web app which aims at providing a sustainable solutions to buyers and sellers of gems/sapphires of the lucrative gem market of Sri Lanka. The traditional method which prevails currently is where the gem-miners (mine owners) presenting the rough stones to the nearest gem dealer where it’s cut and polished, and sold to another party at much higher price. Such sold gems are passed through several intermediate buyers before reaching the final buyer. The idea of this website/web app is to extract the lump sum of profit stacked in the hands of these intermediaries by connecting the final buyer and the gem miner. Basically, the web app would provide the facility to create profiles to both buyers (foreign/local) and sellers and would the sellers could add their gems to the site through their profiles. Only the cut and polished stones would be published and Sapphire.lk would provide several free cutting and polishing services too if required.
A most distinguishing feature of this web app is that caters several pains of the users in a realistic way with the use of sophisticated technology. The website uses Augmented Reality/ Virtual Reality technologies to provide a realistic 3D image of the gemstone to a remote buyer so that he/she could check for the cracks, intrusions of the gem as if it is at his fingertips.

Other creators
Shakthi Weerasinghe Praveen Thrilanka Gamage Nisal Waduge Randilu Soysa

Project descriptionClawOS is a web based application along with a SaaS platform designed and developed for PanelClaw USA a solar mounting systems manufacturer and lay out designer company located in North Andover MA [https://www.panelclaw.com/]
ClawOS front end is implemented using ReactJS, OpenLayers and Google Maps API on top of NodeJS back-end running in AWS lamda. The front-end interacts with a .NET based SaaS application running on top of AWS EC2 auto scaling infrastructure which implements a scalable MATLAB logic executor and a scheduler with a high performance reports generator. This application is engineered to automate and optimize the solar panel layout and designing process of PanelClaw to bring the lead time of a project to a minimal level.

jobs.jobTitle: Editor In Chief for FIT Chronicle
jobs.description:
Having got promoted to Editor-In-Chief of the official publication of the faculty, imparted great responsibility and a challenge. Being one of the trio behind the 'change' of the magazine from 2015, the responsibility in simple words was to carry forward the good work and improve the magazine continously in what ever the way possible. Having tabled a vision for the magazine at it's revamp - 'Continuously improve in quality and content', 2017 edition of the magazine reached that vision far beyond the expectation, having gathered many volunteers with quality content and doubling the content from last year. This was quite a mile stone for the magazine as many features, which were not able to include in the previous were included and provided excessive space to portrait the immense talent of the students in the faculty in all aspects. 
Although, it was great pleasure working with the biggest crew yet for the magazine and it would have not been possible without this team effort.

The main responsibilities were to manage the articles and in fact to make sure that the
      magazine would give the best reader's experience. Hence, the December 2015 issue of
      FIT Chronicles was a whole new version after revamping it in design, content and
      
      brand. Since then, the magazine would have a further issue for 2016.

I had the privilege of working alongside the best industry experts at the "Greatest place to work" in Sri Lanka as trainee software engineer in which a wealth of knowledge and experience was gained. Having worked on a research project and especially in a comprehensive client project : Boligmappa, I had the opportunity of working on a very wide scope of technologies including, Apache Spark, Scala, C#, .NET, Angular 1 and 2, AWS - Dynamo DB, Lambdas, EC2, S3, Serverless, Typescript, WordPress PHP, Node JS, Jenkins, NUnit, Web Services, REST APIs using Steroids Framework, MSSQL and several key integrations such as MailUp and 24Seven Office.  
Apart from the core functionalities, I was able to work in several initiatives including Dotitude - which included organizing several quizzes, 'Dotitude Live' webinars ,Uni Relations - conducting a session on 'CV writing and Online presence' at University of Moratuwa and Badminton, while providing considerable amount of support with Graphic Design for almost all the other initiatives.  
I also had the opportunity in taking part in the 6 day workshop with CEO of Boligmappa in which several key concerns in Boligmappa were discussed.

Global Entrepreneurship Program of AIESEC is a new initiative by the organization where it aims at encouraging and shaping the youth to step out of their comfort zone by taking up Entrepreneurship that will potentially help a local economy or even the world. Therefore, the voluntary internship program to work at a locally reputed Start Up Company, the GE program was initiated for the first time in Sri Lanka at AIESEC Colombo South and I am currently managing the operations of this new venture.

Project nameiCare
Dec 2016

Project descriptioniCare - a wearable health monitoring, detection and remote response system. The system with the wearable unit is more over a smart watch which detects different health conditions by evaluating 3 parameters using sensors. The concept was to create a potentially large network of these device against a distributed server system of independent servers corresponding to each hospital or health care service provider so that any patient, especially the elderly are monitored and taken care of 24x7 with the facility of recording any adnormalitiesa and history of illnesses as monitored by the watch. The device is supported by an android application as well.
The product was later modified to a particular version which was specifically targeted at Diabetic patients. The wearable was able to calculate the glucose level in blood and maintain a database that would allow the machine learning backed to classify (using SVC) and predict future conditions (using kNN and SVR) of diabetic condition in order to provide life long health support in maintaining good health condition not affected by diabetics. 
Therefore iCare is a complete package based on the concept of "Internet of Things" (IoT).
Other creators
Kasun Chinthaka Piyarathna Rakshitha Muranga Rodrigo Dinusha Harankahawa Tharindu Jayathilake

jobs.jobTitle: LEAD CS 4.0 - Oraganizing Commitee Vice President (Delegates)
jobs.description: Lead CS is the annual leadership development conference of AIESEC in University of Moratuwa. What is remarkable about Lead CS is that it is the only conference organized at the national level by an AIESEC Local Committee. First organized in 2014, Lead CS 1.0 – 3.0 was held at the Sanctuary House Negombo. The conference spans throughout 3 days and the delegates are provided with food and accommodation on all 3 days. Conference consists of various sessions, activities and events; few of which are Outbound Training, LEAD sessions, Gala Night, Award Ceremony and Parties. Redefining the standards set by stereotypical leadership development seminars and workshops, Lead CS has been able to provide life changing experiences to the delegates. The conference is often referred to as the turning point of AIESEC career of present and past AIESECers at University of Moratuwa.

general.description:
Manoj graduated with a First-Class degree in Information Technology(Hons) from University of Moratuwa. He competent consultant at Scalable Cloud Architectures, Docker Containers, DevOps, and Serverless. During his leisure time, he does a lot of hacking around Serverless and Serverless based development models. He continuously updates video content on Cloud Architecture on his youtube channel - https://www.youtube.com/awsvideos 

He is a blogger at medium.com and he usually blogs about Cloud Architecture patterns - https://medium.com/@manojf. He also blogs at his personal website https://awsvideos.com 

He is the author of Serverless React Boilerplate (https://github.com/99xt/serverless-react-boilerplate) which got featured at Serverless repository (https://github.com/serverless/serverless). He has contributed to many Open Source projects such as Serverless Dynamodb Local Plugin, Pdf2S3, Serverless Delivery Framework and Serverless Dynamodb Localhost.

He is an excellent problem-solver, able to quickly grasp complex systems and identify opportunities for improvements and resolutions of critical issues with more than three years of experience in software engineering. He is adept in;
* Working closely with system analysts, engineers, programmers and business stakeholders to design solutions and to obtain information on project limitation and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces. 
* Experience on Cloud Architectures, Serverless and DevOps and Event Driven Programming.
* Experience on Single Page Application Development with REST APIs.
* Performance optimization, software architecture and implementation coordination

Specialties: 
AWS Cloud Architectures, Containerization, Build and Release Automation, Web Frontend, and Backend development, Hybrid Mobile development, Agile/Scrum/Kanban/Lean, Angular / React/ VueJs
