Project nameObject Store Server
Dec 2014

Project descriptionObject Store is a middleware for the Mambati platform that enables the developers to perform CRUD operations on various data stores (i.e. Relational, NoSQL, FTP, Hadoop HDFS) using a standard set of REST endpoints. This component provides extensibility features to add support for data stores such as Elastic Search, Couchbase, Cassandra, MongoDB, MySQL, Hive, etc... This middleware is can be customized to work with only a specified set of data stores (i.e. to handle CRUD operations only with Elastic Search and Couchbase) The middleware is written using golang.

Other creators
Prasad Jayashanka Lasitha Senanayake
Project nameCloud Event Bus
Nov 2014

Project descriptionCloud Event Bus is a middleware that facilitates the coordination between entities such as users and middleware components. This component uses event driven architecture which subscribers can listen to events which can be triggered by any entity. Provides functionality to handle global configuration, global state, monitor output of middleware, chat between users, and WebRTC for video conferencing.

Other creators
Lasitha Senanayake Kalana Demel
Project nameUiMicrokernel
Nov 2014

Project descriptionProvides interfaces for app developers to develop fronted business apps that exposes features of Mambati platform such as manipulating data using Duo Object Store, execution of applications inside a shell, event management through cloud event bus, WebRTC video conferencing and chat functionality, etc... Developed using Angular.JS framework and inspired by the Microkernel architecture of Operating Systems.
Other creators
Lasitha Senanayake Eshwaran Veerabahu Dilshan Liyanage
Project nameDuo Object Store DSL (Domain Specific Language)
Jan 2014

Project descriptionDuo Object Store is designed to integrate with heterogeneous databases such as NoSQL and Relational while providing developers a Domain Specific Language (DSL) that enables the developers to store/query/delete C# objects in Duo Object Store that stores objects in such heterogeneous data sources. This approach enables the developer to migrate between different data sources without changing the business logic.

Designed and developed a Domain Specific Language (DSL) which is built on top of LINQ that interacts with Duo Object Store framework that integrates with different data sources.

Other creators
Lasitha Senanayake Chinthaka Thiyambarawatte
Project nameAPIs Developed for DuoV5 Framework/SDK
Project descriptionDesigned and developed an API that provides localization for DuoV5 apps. A mechanism was developed to create and load language packs. The API also enables the developers to switch between languages during runtime.

Designed and developed a SIP (Session Initiation Protocol) API for the DuoV5 framework that in order to receive voice calls that use a 3rd party browser plugin PortSIP. This API encapsulates the underlying communication while allowing the developers to easily use SIP features.

Designed and developed an XMPP (Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol) API for Silverlight in order to provide XMPP chat features for DuoV5 apps. BOSH protocol was used to provide two way communications between the DuoV5 Framework and the XMPP server.

Designed and developed a mechanism to address the problem of nested service calls in Silverlight by allowing the developers to refactor their code in a workflow like hierarchy.
Project nameDuo Framework Server
Project descriptionThe objective of Duo Framework server is to provide two way communication facilities between the frontend and the backend servers.

Designed and developed mechanism to enable the use of multiple protocols such as Web Sockets, HTTP Polling, and TCP.

Designed and developed a mechanism to recover client connections from network breakdowns to provide high availability and fault tolerance.
Other creator
Sudharshan Balakrishnan
Project nameDuo Installer
Project descriptionThe objective of Duo Installer is to automate the release and deployment process of WCF services, backend servers, DuoV5 Framework, and apps created for DuoV5 Framework.

Developed a packaging component known as Setup Creator that enabled the Release Engineer to package all the components and create an installer package. This tool creates a snapshot of an ideal database and all the files of the components and packages everything to a single zip file.

Developed a tool to install and update components of the system which are packaged by the Setup Creator. A mechanism was developed to track DB changes, track component changes and to apply such changes by auto generating DB scripts, and by upgrading necessary files of the components. Another mechanism was developed to automate the deployment of WCF services in IIS, as well as to automatically change WCF client endpoint URLs in web.config.
Other creators
Sudharshan Balakrishnan Chinthaka Thiyambarawatte Lasitha Senanayake
Project nameDuo Search API
Project descriptionThe objective of Duo Search API is to provide full text searching capabilities to WCF services in the while reducing the number of database calls. The API allows the developers to add, edit, delete and search objects from an index. The index can be configured to use a distributed search server or to store in local hard drive.

Designed and developed an API for distributed searching that uses Elastic Search.

Designed and developed an API for local indexing that uses Lucene.NET.
Project nameDuo Service Console
Project descriptionThe objectives of service console are to schedule jobs and perform operations on large data sets.
Designed and developed a framework to develop various operations to address business requirements that can be performed on large data sets.

Designed and developed a mechanism break a large excel file into smaller parts and perform bulk operations in a multi-threaded environment.

Designed and developed a mechanism to schedule the operations developed by the API.
Other creators
Lasitha Senanayake Sudharshan Balakrishnan
Project nameDuo V5 Silverlight Framework/SDK
Project descriptionThe purpose of DuoV5 Framework/SDK is to provide a platform to develop various frontend functionalities to address business requirements. Such functionaries include forms, designers, etc… Such functionalities are known as apps in Duo V5 framework.

Designed and developed a mechanism that enabled developers to develop their apps, compile to DLL files and host in IIS. This approach reduced the Silverlight XAP file size, enabled modularization of components, allowed components to be changed, added or removed with less effort.

Designed and developed a host for the apps to be downloaded and displayed in Silverlight. That included an attractive frontend, and provided extensive usability and user experience. 

Designed and developed an emulator that enabled to develop, debug, and test Duo V5 apps separately outside of the main Silverlight host. In order to use the emulator a set of visual studio templates were created that are configured specifically for the emulator. 

Developed a Visual Studio add in that enabled the developers to publish their compiled apps.

Other creators
Lasitha Senanayake Chinthaka Thiyambarawatte Sudharshan Balakrishnan Sajeetharan Sinnathurai Eshwaran Veerabahu
Project nameDuo World DevStudio
Project descriptionIDE that enables the developers to develop business apps for the duo world platform. Enables the developers to focus more on developing apps using features provided by Mambati platform. Consists of features such as GitHub integration, project sharing between users, app publishing for the Duo World Marketplace.

jobs.description:
Responsible for implementation and development of software systems and have an excellent understanding of the final goal and the customer requirement. Provide the team with a vision of the project objectives, communicate clear instructions to team members. Also Facilitate problem solving and collaboration and coordinate with internal and external customers as necessary. Familiarize the team with the customer needs, specifications, design targets, the development process, design standards, techniques and tools to support task performance. Assure that the team addresses all relevant issues within the specifications and various standards. Ensure deliverable are prepared to satisfy the project requirements and schedule. Keep the project manager informed of task accomplishment, issues and status. Escalate issues which cannot be resolved by the team and provide guidance to the team based on management direction. Assure that the team addresses all relevant issues within the specifications and various standards.
Responding promptly and professionally to bug reports and respond promptly to the requests/modifications/inquiries made by the client. Proactively assist the team to deliver the change requests. Assist the project manager for time estimations, during the project planning stage. Communicate the status of the tasks on a daily basis to the Project Manager during the scrum meeting.
Assist/guide/mentor junior programmers.
Document code consistently throughout the development process by listing a description of the program, special instructions, and any changes made in database tables on procedural, modular and database level. Tests new programs to ensure that logic and syntax are correct, and that program results are accurate.

Responsible for the technical development, debugging, and delivery of best- in-class mobile applications (iOS and Android).   Work across a wide range of projects, each with specific functional and feature requirements.  Collaborate closely with product managers, user interface designers, platform engineers, and multiple groups across CBS to define and implement product features.  Build high-level user interfaces using rapid prototyping methodologies.  Design application frameworks for use across the multiple products. 
Work with internal technical teams to identify and build platform elements required to support key mobile product features.  Evaluate opportunities to bring new product features and content to mobile users from a technical perspective. Build strong working relationships with coworkers, customers (internal and external), and company management

Design and build advanced applications for the iOS platform. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features. Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability. Work on bug fixing and improving application performance. Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency. Implementing custom native interfaces using the latest iOS programming techniques and building reusable iOS software components for iPhone applications. Analyzing and optimizing application code for efficiency and performance.

projects.description:

Aug 2016

Project descriptionDo you have a dusty folder overflowing with worn receipts from years of purchases? ProductFriend stores your product purchase and warranty information in the cloud for you to access anytime, anywhere – for free!

projects.description:
Did - The Calendar is the Timesheet
Aug 2010 – Present

Project descriptionDid™ simply leverages what you already use: your calendar in Microsoft Outlook. Did knows about your customers and your projects and uses the information in your calendar appointments to build your timesheet. Did™ does not make use of any custom plugins for Outlook, but supports simple conventions to allow you to make sure the timesheet is completed automatically. 

Did™ builds on standard Outlook functionality such as categories and private marking. Your privates will never be seen in Did, and personal appointments you'd like your colleagues to see, you'll just tag it with a category to have Did™ will automatically ignore it.

With Did™ the Outlook calendar is now your primary tool for completing your timesheets. All you need to do is to make sure that your schedule is accurate.​

Other creators

When it comes to software engineering design decision making, I am an individual who prefer performance over modularity where response time is a game changer. I believe simple designs based on few basic concepts as possible results in less buggy, very readable and highly maintainable code. With new libraries/frameworks/design patterns coming in fast, it can be hard to decide which is good. With the knowledge of computing fundamentals, one has to evaluate new technologies and predict/prevent future product failures in performance or maintainability. I believe keeping client’s satisfaction and their smooth operation in mind, is the key to building long term relationships with them.

general.headline: Software Engineer at 99X Technology
general.school: Sri Lanka Institue of Information Technology

jobs.description:
99X Technologies is a company where it headquartered in Sri Lanka with offices in Oslo, Norway. It is one of Asia’s best workplaces and a regional leader in Agile product engineering and technology innovation. 
I have joined 99XT as a Software Engineer and assigned to an ongoing project. Initially i was started with a good heads up about the project environment and the technology stack such as AWS lambda, Serverless, SQS, SNS, EC2, Angular 4, NodeJs, Typescript, etc. Currently I have handled several research tasks(POC-proof of concepts) and make use of it in the project to full fill the client needs. Since we are directly dealing with the clients I was able to gain not only the technical knowledge but also the client communication skills too.

Populo PVT LTD is a startup which provides software solutions for campus networks where it has a private social network for high-school and universities. I was appointed as a full stack engineer for the product Gradchat. 
As a full stack engineer,
Mainly my task was to developing and maintaining the backend of the application where it has a promising tech stack and building infrastructure of product.
Basically I am working with Java(Play Framework), Angular 2, Docker, AWS services as the major technology stack in Populo.

Zone24x7 is a fast growing technology company which serves for leading clients in the industry by providing custom hardware designs to software and implementations with great quality. Headquarter is in San Jose California, USA.
As a Trainee Associate Software Engineer,

Big Data Team 

As developer in big data team I have experienced with several valuable technologies such as Java(Play Framework), Ebean, Rest technology, Guice dependency injection mechanism which leads to provide a structure of object creation in the startup of the application, Azkaban job scheduler,HDFS file system, Apache HBase, Pig Script, Azkaban Web AJAX API, MapReduce jobs, etc. With the help of these technologies I was appointed to manage Rest API which helps to create a particular user to build his/her own API. So that he or she does not want to bother about an API implementation and they can build up their own API.

Innovation Team

As an innovation team member I have been working on a supervised bot application which has been implemented using python 2.7 and CISCO SPARK as the platform which is used to replace the messaging platform. In this application the main concept was to having a common platform where any bot can be integrated in to it and used it. 
After that I have been working under a project which is using a raspberry 3 with voice recognition through google API. In this project the main tech stack was python 2.7, pyqt5, google voice recognition API. 
And then I was assigned a project where it has an indoor navigation system which can guide an associate inside a large scale store to find out the products/items to be collected which has been ordered online. This was a windows mobile application since it uses Bluebird device which is a very powerful device which can be very helpful for scenarios like this. So that it mainly uses visual studio(C#) as the development environment.

As an intern in 90AD Technologies I,
*have developed web sites according to their requirements and also participated in the designing sector as well.
*have learned some new technologies such as JSON and to build responsive mobile sites using Bootstrap.

projects.description:
Easy way to Health
Apr 2016 – Present

Project descriptionEasy Way to Health changes the way people weigh themselves and interact with scales. We developed a proprietary, patent pending weight management system that receives weight measurements from Wi-Fi scales, allowing us to translate individual’s natural weight fluctuation into a trend. Our interface uses a speedometer type gauge (Change-o-meter™) that anticipates weight trend changes two weeks in advance helping our users understand and control their weight. Because our scales do not display weight readout numbers and we treat weight as a trend, our solution is proving to reduce people’s frustration with scales, which in turn makes self-weighing a more motivational and effective process: more people will achieve more sustainable weight loss.

general.headline: Technical Lead at WSO2
general.description:
I have 6+ years of industry experience on developing and architecting Cloud and SOA Middleware technologies using core Java as the back-end. I lead WSO2 Testgrid, a highly scalable test bed that validate wso2 products on different environments. I was a core member of Carbon platform where I worked on distributed clustering, microservices and Docker scripts. I visit customer sites where I play the solution architect role to lead customers achieve success by leveraging the WSO2 products. I am also a frequent speaker at Java Colombo, WSO2 conferences and other events. 

I work as a Technical Lead at WSO2, and I have won the "Most Outstanding Contributor Award" in years 2012, 2015, and 2017.

My recent work,
- Testgrid, a distributed SaaS service that tests WSO2 products against variety of cloud providers, and databases. It was developed from scratch using core Java, Spring, Hibernate JPA as the ORM, ReactJS for front-end, JAX-RS for Restful microservices, on top of Amazon AWS cloud. Jenkins was the CI/CD provider. 
We run functional tests, performance tests, long running, and chaos tests on top of the above provisioned infrastructure.

- WSO2 Identity and Access Management, which is built on Java with JavaEE technologies like Servlets, JSP, JPA, JAX-RS, and Websocket. I helped integrate identity technologies SAML SSO, OAuth2.0, OIDC into enterprise customer deployments.

I hold a BSc first class degree in Computer Science & Eng from University of Moratuwa, Sri Lanka. I was placed at top 5% of the batch.

Specialties :
 – Core Java development
 – Enterprise Integration Architect of WSO2 Middleware stack including ESB, WSO2 API Manager
 – Design AWS/Azure cloud-based application development and deployment
 – OSS contributor of Apache, DocBook, and Gentoo Linux 
 – Mentor university students under the Google SoC program.

 – Technologies :
Java, REST/SOAP Web Services; AWS, Azure; Spring, Hibernate
Jenkins, Puppet 
Bash; Git; XML, XSL, DocBook; Gentoo Linux, Ubuntu, RHEL

jobs.description:
I lead the WSO2's Testgrid project which is being developed to increase customer confidence on WSO2. It does automated deployment and validation of WSO2 products in all possible combinations of environments WSO2 supports.

The environments we provision include cloud-providers including AWS, Azure, OpenStack, K8S, all common RDBMS, Java Runtimes Oracle, OpenJDK, and so on. The WSO2 products are then set-up, and finally functional and non-functional tests are run via CI/CD automated pipelines.

    Worked on a diverse areas including
      

    * Research & Development
      

    
      * Overseas customer engagements

... See more

Maintainer of DocBook WebHelp XSL customization of the DocBook Project.

WebHelp XSL customization provides a sophisticated web publishing option for XML-based DocBook documents. It provides offline search, auto-generated table-of-contents as a tree view.

This was a integration project that is built on top of IBM MQ for JMS messaging and
      wso2 esb foreriting restful services. Business process workflows were implemented via
      BPMN with Activi engine. I acted as the wso2 consultant where I implemented REST
      
      services, BPMN workflows, and train the team members about wso2 technologies.

Provide consultancy for an integration project involving wso2 esb. Developed RESTful
      
      APIs, data services on top of wso2 product stack.

Gentoo Maven Integration Project with Gentoo-Java herd. 

Designed the system to fill the gap of incompatibilities between Gentoo build system and Maven build system, added patches to maven upstream projects to match the incompatibilities
Wrote 50+ ebuild scripts and eclasses (an extended version of bash scripts).

Context:
Gentoo is a Linux-based Operating System mainly intended and adapted by power users. It uses portage as the package management system which is characterized by its main function of compiling from source the packages the user wishes to install.

Apache Maven integration to Gentoo Linux is facilitated the packagers to package maven-based Java packages such that all the complexity raised by Maven is transparent to the user. I have wrote ebuilds to build Apache Maven itself, and it's 50+ dependencies from source. And then, I wrote two eclasses with collaboration of Gentoo Java herd.

Google Summer of Code 2010 student, development of DocBook WebHelp project

WebHelp XSL customization provides a sophisticated web publishing option for XML-based DocBook documents. It has addressed the long-waited need of a better web publishing option for technical documentations for DocBook.

Webhelp search indexer, derived from HTMLSearch DITA Plugin, is an off-line search engine. It indexes the html contents using an Indexer (which is based on Java), and outputs a browser based search mechanism. Components include the Java-based indexer, and the JavaScript-based index.

Performance improvement of Apache Axiom's DOM-Module - The goal was to improve the throughput of Apache Rampart. Did a profiling and the code was refactored according to it.

Gained exposure to technologies - Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), Web Services, StAX API, WSO2 middleware platform, Apache Axis2, and Apache Axiom.

      systems are used by exchange businesses around the world including,London Stock

OpenReID is an open set person re-identification (identification same person through different cameras) system which is written as a subsection of my final year group project "Human analytics using video feeds". I am the lead developer of the OpenReID system and a co-author of the paper "Open Set Person Re-id using Closed Set Re-id Framework" which is based on the OpenReID system. The paper was accepted and presented to the International Conference on Signal and Image Processing (ICSIP 2017) which was held in Singapore on  4-6 Aug 2017. The OpenReID system have been written using Matlab,Octave and Java

I was a development Intern at Millennium IT .Created a File Analyzing tool which is based on C++ and linux servers and developed the official Millennium IT technology day 2016 registration web app back end. Technologies used are C++, Boost library, Linux, GDB, VisualStudio 2015, Perl, Java, TestNG, Oracle(impdp and expdp), SqlDeveloper, Laravel, phpmyadmin, HTML, CSS, XShell and few Millennium IT specific tools such as SysGuard, ServiceDesk, SystemReplay and RefData.

TradeZ Investor v2.0 : This a system which was create to help stock market investors in their decision making.It includes all the facilities which should be satisfied for a better investment and higher profit.This system have been implemented using C# , ADO.NET , MySQL and chrome web driver.

TradeZ Analyzer v1.0 : A program which implements machine learning and data mining approaches towards Colombo Stock Exchange data to tell the investor about current trends and where to invest money. This is a platform independent supportive program. Used technologies : Python, Machine learning algorithms. Both the above systems are enriched with past 6 years of data of CSE.

I was the team leader of the project "Hodiya" under iGCDP AIESEC-CS."Hodiya" is a project which is initiated by AIESEC incoming Global Community Development Programme on behalf of uplifting language literacy of pre-school children in Sri Lanka.The project was successfully completed with the number of 31 exchange persons from countries Germany,Brazil,Russia,Netherlands,China,Malaysia,UK,Taiwan and Croatia .Exchange persons stayed in Sri Lanka for one and half months and they engaged in pre-school teaching.
